questions.question_text: What was the man doing recently?

options.text: He was enjoying his holiday.
He was recovering in hospital.
He was busy writing his essays.
He was fighting a throat infection.

questions.question_text: What happened to David?

options.text: He broke his wrist.
He lost his antibiotics.
He slipped on ice and fell.
He was laughed at by some girls.

questions.question_text: What will the woman probably do with her broken laptop?

options.text: Turn to her father for help.
Call the repair shop to fix it.
Ask the manufacturer for repairs.
Replace it with a brand-new one.

questions.question_text: What does the woman offer to do for David?

options.text: Help David retrieve his essays.
Introduce David to her parents.
Offer David some refreshments.
Accompany David to his home.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the woman?

options.text: She is a critic of works on military affairs.
She is an acclaimed hostess of Book Talk.
She is a researcher of literary genres.
She is a historian of military history.

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about her new book?

options.text: It is about the military history of Europe.
It is set in the 18th and 19th centuries.
It is her fifth book of military history.
It is a war novel set in the future.

questions.question_text: What did the woman do for her research?

options.text: She visited soldiers' wives and mothers.
She conducted surveys of many soldiers.
She met a large number of soldiers in person.
She looked into the personal lives of soldiers.

questions.question_text: What difficulty does the woman have in writing military history?

options.text: She doesn't have much freedom for imagination.
It is not easy to make her readers believe in her.
It is difficult to attract young readers.
She has to combine fact with fiction.

questions.question_text: What was originally printed on the bottle of a famous drink?

options.text: Santa Claus.
A polar bear.
Cocoa seeds.
A glass bottle.

questions.question_text: Why did the drink company change its bottle design?

options.text: To attract customer attention.
To keep up with the times.
To combat counterfeits.
To promote its sales.

questions.question_text: What does the new bottle look like?

options.text: It resembles a picture in the encyclopedia.
It appears in the shape of a cocoa seed.
It has the drink's logo in the middle.
It displays the image of Santa Claus.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about small talk?

options.text: It often occurs among commuters.
It promotes mutual understanding.
It improves their mood considerably.
It takes a great deal of effort to sustain.

questions.question_text: What prevents some people from starting small talk?

options.text: Social anxiety.
Excessive caution.
Lack of social skills.
Preference for solitude.

questions.question_text: Why do people remember negative experiences in conversations?

options.text: People usually regard it as an unforgettable lesson.
Human brains tend to dwell on negative events.
Negative events often hurt people deeply.
People generally resent being rejected.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about the fear of small talk?

options.text: Contagious.
Temporary.
Unpredictable.
Measurable.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about the economy of the Dominican Republic?

options.text: It depends heavily on tourism.
It is flourishing in foreign trade.
It is mainly based on agriculture.
It relies chiefly on mineral export.

questions.question_text: What is the most important agricultural export of the Dominican Republic?

options.text: Tobacco.
Bananas.
Coffee.
Sugar.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about the wealthy people in the Dominican Republic?

options.text: They toil on farms.
They live a poor life.
They live in Spanish-style houses.
They hire people to do housework.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about children who get everything they want?

options.text: They will be more demanding of their next generation.
They will end up lonely, dependent and dissatisfied.
They will experience more setbacks than successes.
They will find it difficult to get along with others.

questions.question_text: What do parents often fail to do according to the speaker?

options.text: Failure to pay due attention to their behavior.
Unwillingness to allow them to play with toys.
Unwillingness to satisfy their wishes immediately.
Failure to spend sufficient quality time with them.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about letting children experience frustration?

options.text: It will enable them to learn from mistakes.
It will help them to handle disappointment.
It will do much good to their mental health.
It will build their ability to endure hardships.

questions.question_text: What is the most common mistake job applicants make in interviews?

options.text: Failing to make sufficient preparations.
Looking away from the hiring manager.
Saying the wrong thing at the wrong time.
Making a wrong judgment of the interview.

questions.question_text: What should job applicants avoid doing in an interview?

options.text: Complaining about their previous job.
Inquiring about their salary to be paid.
Exaggerating their academic background.
Understating their previous achievements.

questions.question_text: What kind of employees do employers prefer?

options.text: Those who have both skill and experience.
Those who get along well with colleagues.
Those who take initiative in their work.
Those who are loyal to their managers.

questions.question_text: What do employers value most in job applicants?

options.text: Ability to shoulder new responsibilities.
Experience of performing multiple roles.
Readiness to work to flexible schedules.
Skills to communicate with colleagues.
